Anjana buys a purse for \( R s .523 .80 \)
including \( 8 \% \) VAT. Find the new selling price of the purse if VAT increase to \( 10 \% \)
label: maths

text:
When was the first test tube baby born?
A. 2 January 1981
B. 25 July 1978
c. 3 August 1975
D. 4 February 1982
label: biology

text:
If \( f(x)=x^{3}-3 \) and \( g(x)=7 x^{5}, \) what
is the approximate value of \( \boldsymbol{f}(\boldsymbol{g}(\boldsymbol{3} . \boldsymbol{9})) ? \)
A . 389.23
в. 938.32
c. 4261.48
D. 11086.57
E . 14257.91
label: maths

text:
Write down the general features of
fungi
label: biology

text:
Suppose \( x \) and \( y \) are real numbers such that \( \tan x+\tan y=42 \) and \( \cot x+ \)
\( \cot y=49, \) then the single digit prime
number by which the value of
\( \tan (x+y) \) is not divisible is
label: maths

text:
In a two step pulley arrangement meant
for a load \( \mathrm{W} \), the ratio between force \( \mathrm{P} \)
and \( W \) in equilibrium position, when
radii of pulleys are \( r_{1} \) and \( r_{2} \)
A \( \cdot \frac{r_{2}}{r_{1}-r_{2}} \)
B. \( \frac{r_{1}-r_{2}}{r_{2}} \)
c. \( \frac{r_{1}}{r_{2}-r_{1}} \)
D. \( \frac{r_{2}-r_{1}}{r_{1}} \)
label: physics

text:
For three number \( a, b, c \) product of the average of the number \( a^{2}, b^{2}, c^{2} \) and \( \frac{1}{a^{2}} \) \( \frac{1}{b^{2}}, \frac{1}{c^{2}} \) can not be less than
\( A \)
B. 3
\( c \cdot 9 \)
D. none of these
label: maths

text:
What is the degree of the differential eqaution \( : \frac{d^{3} y}{d x^{3}}-6\left(\frac{d y}{d x}\right)^{2}-4 y=0 \)
\( A \)
B. 2
\( c \cdot 3 \)
D. None of these
label: maths

text:
An aeroplane drops a parachutist. After covering a distance of \( 40 \mathrm{m} \), he opens
the parachute and retards at \( 2 m s^{-1} . \) If he reaches the ground with a speed of
\( 2 m s^{-1}, \) he remains in the air for about
A . \( 16 s \)
B. 3
c. \( 13 s \)
D. 10 \( s \)
label: physics

text:
8 times a 2 digit number is equal to 3 times the number obtained by reversing
the order of the digit. If the difference
between digit is 5 then find the number.
label: maths

text:
A potentiometer wire of length \( L \) and a
resistance \( r \) are connected in series
with a battery of e.m.f. \( \boldsymbol{E}_{0} \) and \( \mathbf{a} \)
resistance \( r_{1} . \) An unknown e.m.f. \( \boldsymbol{E} \) is
balanced at a length \( l \) of the
potentiometer wire. The e.m.f. \( \boldsymbol{E} \) will be
given by:
A \( \cdot \frac{L E_{0} r}{\left(r+r_{1}\right) l} \)
в. \( \frac{L E_{0} r}{l r_{1}} \)
\( \mathbf{c} \cdot \frac{E_{0} r}{\left(r+r_{1}\right)} \cdot \frac{l}{L} \)
D. \( \frac{E_{0} l}{L} \)
label: physics

text:
If \( \boldsymbol{y}=\frac{1}{\mathbf{3 - 4 x}} \) then \( \boldsymbol{y}_{n}(1) \) equals
A .
B \( \cdot(-1)^{n+1} n ! \)
c. \( n ! 4^{n}(-1)^{n+1} \)
D. None of these
label: maths

text:
Consider the integral \( \boldsymbol{I}= \) \( \int_{0}^{\pi} \ln (\sin x) d x . \) What is \( \int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{2}} \ln \)
\( (\sin x) d x \) equal to?
A . \( 4 I \)
B. 2I \( I \)
c. \( I \)
D. \( \frac{I}{2} \)
label: maths

text:
Two capacitors of capacitance \( C_{1} \) and
\( C_{2} \) are connected in parallel across a
battery. If \( Q_{1} \) and \( Q_{2} \) respectively be the charges on the capacitors, then \( \frac{Q_{1}}{Q_{2}} \) will be equal to :
A. \( \frac{C_{2}}{C_{1}} \)
в. \( \frac{C_{1}}{C_{2}} \)
c. \( \frac{C_{1}^{2}}{C_{2}^{2}} \)
D. \( \frac{C_{2}^{2}}{C_{1}^{2}} \)
label: physics

text:
The maximum current which can flow
through a fuse without melting it is called its
A. potential
B. power
c. rating
D. capacity
label: physics

text:
The number and type of bonds between two carbon atoms in calcium carbide
are :
A. one sigma, one pi
B. one sigma, two pi
c. two sigma, one pi
D. two sigma, two pi
label: chemistry

text:
\( \boldsymbol{H} \boldsymbol{C} \boldsymbol{N}(\boldsymbol{a} \boldsymbol{q}) \rightarrow \boldsymbol{H}^{+}(\boldsymbol{a} \boldsymbol{q})+\boldsymbol{C} \boldsymbol{N}^{-}(\boldsymbol{a} \boldsymbol{q}) \)
According to above reaction, the Hydrocyanic acid dissociates, find the
acid dissociation constant for \( \boldsymbol{H} \boldsymbol{C} \boldsymbol{N} \) ?
\( ^{\mathbf{A}} \cdot \frac{\left[H^{+}\right]\left[C N^{-}\right]}{[H C N]} \)
в. \( \left[H^{+}\right]\left[C N^{-}\right][H C N] \)
c. \( \frac{[H C N]}{\left[H^{+}\right]\left[C N^{-}\right]} \)
D. \( \frac{\left[H^{+}\right]}{[H C N]\left[C N^{-}\right]} \)
E \( \frac{1}{[H C N]\left[H^{+}\right]\left[C N^{-}\right]} \)
label: chemistry

text:
The radius of a nucleus of an atom
\( (Z=50) \) is \( 9 \times 10^{-10} m \) then potential
on its surface, will be:
A . \( 80 V \)
B. \( 8 k V \)
\( \mathrm{c} .9 \mathrm{V} \)
D. \( 9 k V \)
label: physics

text:
The increasing order of the rate of
oxidation with \( H I O_{4} \) of the following is:
\( (\Pi) \)
(III)
\( (\mathrm{IV}) \)
A. \( |V<\|\mid<\|<1 \)
B. \( |<||<|||<\mid V \)
C. \( |V<\|\mid=\|<1 \)
D. \( \mid<\|=\|<I V \)
label: chemistry

text:
Explain why an induced current must flow in such a direction so as to oppose
the change producing it
label: physics

text:
Axis of a parabola is \( y=x \) and vertex
and focus are at a distance \( \sqrt{2} \) and \( 2 \sqrt{2} \) respectively from the origin. The equation of the parabola is
A \( \cdot(x-y)^{2}=8(x+y-2) \)
B . \( (x+y)^{2}=2(x+y-2) \)
c. \( (x-y)^{2}=4(x+y-2) \)
D. \( (x+y)^{2}=2(x-y+2) \)
label: maths

text:
\( \boldsymbol{A}=\left[\begin{array}{lll}\mathbf{1} & \mathbf{2} & \mathbf{3} \\ \mathbf{4} & \mathbf{5} & \mathbf{6} \\ \mathbf{7} & \mathbf{1} & \mathbf{0}\end{array}\right], \boldsymbol{B}=\left[\begin{array}{lll}\mathbf{1} & \mathbf{0} & \mathbf{0} \\ \mathbf{0} & \mathbf{3} & \mathbf{0} \\ \mathbf{0} & \mathbf{4} & \mathbf{5}\end{array}\right] \)
\( \operatorname{Tr}(A B)=\lambda \operatorname{Tr}(\mathrm{A}) . \operatorname{Tr}(\mathrm{B}), \) then \( \lambda= \)
\( A \)
B. 0
\( c \cdot \frac{6}{5} \)
\( \frac{20}{27} \)
label: maths

text:
Graphite powder is used in machines to
A. enhance friction
B. enhance profit
c. reduce friction
D. reduce efficiency
label: physics

text:
If \( g_{E} \) and \( g_{M} \) are the accelerations due
to gravity on the surfaces of the Earth and the Moon respectively and if Millikan's oil drop experiment could be performed on the two surfaces, one will find the ratio (electronic charge on the Moon/ electronic charge on the Earth) to be:
A . 1
B.
\( \mathbf{c} \cdot g_{E} / g_{M} \)
D. \( g_{M} / g_{E} \)
label: physics
